alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 7:01PM PDT until August 01 at 8:15PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Inyo County in south central California... * Until 815 PM PDT. * At 701 PM PDT, Local law enforcement reported parts of State Route 190 impassable near Towne Pass between Panamint Springs and Stovepipe Wells. While heavy rain has ended in the area, the runoff from earlier heavy rainfall continues. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... State Route 190 between Panamint Springs and Stovepipe Wells. Local law enforcement reported that State Route 190 was completely impassable east of Panamint Valley Road Junction. Large flow of debris and rocks on roadway. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
